CatDescriptText: William Birt, retired, Beltzhoover and Miss Betty Wheeler, Rankin, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, September 2, 1961, pg. 7 with question: " Do you think police could wipe out all the rackets if they launched an intense, earnest campaign against vice and crime?"  Mr. Birt's answer reads: "No, I don't think it can be done.  They haven't don it yet."  Ms. Wheeler's answer reads: "I think so.  People know that crime doesn't pay and that the police will catch up with you eventually."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of William Birt wearing patterned short sleeved shirt and hat, standing in front of pedestrians and building; Portrait of Betty Wheeler wearing light colored button down collared dress with bow at neckline, standing in front of glass block window
